fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`ib VPBLENDD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128, imm8`
`ib VPBLENDD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256, imm8`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Dword elements from the source operand (second operand) are conditionally written to the destination operand (first operand) depending on bits in the immediate operand (third operand). The immediate bits (bits 7:0) form a mask that determines whether the corresponding word in the destination is copied from the source. If a bit in the mask, corresponding to a word, is “1", then the word is copied, else the word is unchanged.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The second source operand can be an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. The first source and destination operands are XMM registers. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding YMM register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The first source operand is a YMM register. The second source operand is a YMM register or a 256-bit memory location. The destination operand is a YMM register.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
